snippet: Iranians are gradually liberalizing while increasingly orthodox Israelis are drifting toward theocracy.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Abbas Milani, head of Iranian studies program at Stanford, and political science Prof Israel Waismel-Manor warns that both Iran and Israel are now entering potentially challenging new stages in their relations with the outside world, particularly the United States; highlights demographic trends that suggest that Iran is liberalizing while increasingly orthodox Israelis are pushing country more toward theocracy.

byline.original: By ABBAS MILANI and ISRAEL WAISMEL-MANOR

lead_paragraph: Iranians are gradually liberalizing while increasingly orthodox Israelis are drifting toward theocracy.

headline.main: Are Iran and Israel Trading Places?
headline.print_headline: Are Iran and Israel Trading Places?
